title: Methodology
text:
Resources: UNCTAD Commodity Price Index
CPI: commodity price index: an index average (weighted) of selected commodity prices, which may be based on spot or future prices. It tracks a basket of commodities to measure their performance.
Categories:

energy (coal, crude oil, ethanol, gas oil, gasoline, nature gas)
metals

base metals (lead, zinc, nickel, copper)
precious metals (gold, silver, platinum, palladium)

agriculture

grains (corn, oats, rice, soybeans, wheat)
softs (coffee, cocoa, sugar, butter, cotton, milk)
livestock (hogs, live cattle, pork bellies, feeder cattle)



Weights
Weights determine how much importance each commodity have on the overall index
Derived from UNSD Comtrade database.


Prices
Derived from a representative sample of monthly, weekly or daily spot-market quotations, in USD
Many are published, but not all
\[L_{t,0}= \frac{\sum^n_{i=1} p_{i,t} q_{i,0}}{\sum^n_{i=1} p_{i,0} q_{i,0}} = \sum^n_{i=1} \frac{p_i^t}{p_i^0} s_i^0\]

\(s_i^0\): weight of commodity item i
\(p_i^t\): price in period t
\(q_i^0\): quantity of commodity item i in the base period

title: Projects overview
text:
Commodity dependence (over 60% of a country’s merchandise export revenue comes from these raw materials) hinders growth and development. This is due to the exposure to volatile commodity markets and global shocks such as Covid-19 and Ukraine War. If a country relies on a single commodity, the risk is worse.
12% of advanced economies (such as Australia and Norway) are on the list, while 74% were some of the least developed countries.
Comodity price rose sharply during Covid-19 pandemic
Action:

diversification towards sectors with high potential to create jobs and boost income
align education to the skills needed
diversify along low-emission paths

title: Projects overview
text:
Motivation
Statistics on monthly and annual development of commodity prices ad CPI (UNCTAD CPI) are released. This is divided by commodity groups. Monthly update is made 2 months later; annual update made in February for preliminary version and October for final version.

title: Internal methodology
text:
UNCTADstat target tables

monthly price from Jan 1995 to month m-1
monthly price indices from Jan 1995 to month m-1
annual price from 1995 to year y-1
annual price indices from 1995 to year y-1

Data collection methods

email from figures or data sheets
download from websites
through web APIs
automatically update Excels with API
copy figures from PDFs

title: Internal methodology
text:
Data collection and validation collect_v2-0.R
Harvesters/*: these are functions that download and put the data as csv

Pseudo: load data from S folder
Harvester: load via API, e.g. 5110 from World Bank

Depends on functions in

review-collected_v4.R
integrate.R
check-multiple.R

title: Internal methodology
text:
Prelim - analysis

Data coverage, CPS_Dataediting_v2.R
Depends on functions in

mis-units_v2.R, if the price series is completely missing, by comparing with the updated.csv
mis-ob_v2.R, partially missing
benchmark.R, Imputation for missing
check-multiple.R

produce input-prices.csv


Check produced price checks_prices_v2
Depends on functions in

chk.revisions: identify revisions and order by degree
chk.graph: check with visualization

title: World Bank replacements
text:
Motivation: replace the commodity products from their original sources by equivalent items from World Bank (5110).
Abbreviations:

title: World Bank replacements
text:
Metals
There are 16 unique series code (for metals) from MB, and they match the ones in meta. This is not surprising.
Now the task is to match the series in WB with the existing ones. WB series does not have series code. Some are identical; some differ by a scale (possibly due to exchange rate?); some do not exist in WB data.










Name
Code
Column in WB data
Alternative source
Comment




Gold


MB
OK


Copper


MB
260300.01 code has same trend but different values


Aluminium


MB
OK


Silver


MB
OK, differ by 100 times


Nickel


MB
OK


Zinc



OK


Platinum

MB

OK


Lead


MB
OK


Tin


MB
OK


Manganese


MB
Not available in WB


Iron
260100.02, 03
-
TR
TR Only available from 2010.9 for both. WB uses code 02, can directly replace.

title: Aspects of interest
text: A few projects that could be interesting to learn more about. Need to be an overlap between skills to develop and data available.

title: Aspects of interest
text:
Commodity prices
Monthly updated commodity prices using sources from World Bank, IMF.

Nowcasting?
